alert.note: Alert for Anson; Cumberland; Hoke; Richmond; Sampson; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 17 at 7:11PM EST until December 18 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Anson, Chatham, Cumberland, Durham, Edgecombe, Franklin, Granville, Halifax, Harnett, Hoke, Johnston, Lee, Montgomery, Moore, Nash, Orange, Person, Richmond, Sampson, Scotland, Vance, Wake, Warren, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread rain, heavy at times, will spread across the area through tonight. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected, with locally higher amounts. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Anson; Cumberland; Hoke; Richmond; Sampson; Scotland
